How to Clean your mx/supermoto plastics.

If your plastics are in good shape, just rub em down with some kind of stripper or thinner that you have around the house, ie “super goo off”, and call it a day.

If on the other hand your bike is tossed down the track by guys who think they specifically paid $200 to have a free crash a bike day, and your plastics are completely tore up (see pic), this technique will do it.

Materials:
thrashed plastics.
orange pumice hand cleaner
some fine sand paper.
peanut butter
beer

Directions:
1) Open/drink beer. I said beer not coors/bud light. Life is short, go ahead and get some double bock arrogant bastard.
2) Clean the plastics with simple green or like cleaner. Notice the plastics look exactly the same as before you started cleaning.
3) Put some pumice stuff on sandpaper and start sanding away.
4) Repeat 400 times with plenty of beer breaks.
5) Plastics are looking relatively one color now. Whipe with cleaner again.
6) Gulp, man that’s good!
7) Put some smooth peanut butter on a rag and rub it into your plastics. I’m not sure how much this helps, but I saw it as a “restore plastic trim” technique on the interwebs, and well the interwebs wouldn’t lie would it? Makes for good placebo effect if nothing else.
Better have one more, you did a hell of a job.

After:
